l3vpn_schema.description:
Layer 3 Virtual Private Network (L3VPN). An L3VPN is a virtual
private network set up over public networks by Internet Service
Providers (ISPs) and Network Service Providers (NSPs).

routing_schema.description: Configuration parameters for the routing module.

routing-manage.description: Configure the routing management module to store and select optimal routes.

enable.description: Enable/disable route recursion to tunnel. By default, this configuration takes effect for all routes. If an IP prefix list is configured, the configuration takes effect only for the routes that match the IP prefix list. If a tunnel policy is configured, routes carry the tunnel policy information when recursing to a tunnel.

ipv4-prefix-ref.description: Name of an IPv4 prefix list.

relay-label.description: Configure route recursion to remotely leaked VPN routes globally.

ipv4-set.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast routes to remotely leaked VPN routes.

ipv6-set.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv6 unicast routes to remotely leaked VPN routes.

ipv4-threshold.description: Configure thresholds (one alarm threshold and one clear alarm threshold) for the number of IPv4 route prefixes.

upper-percent.description: Upper limit for the number of IPv4 route prefixes.

lower-percent.description: Lower limit for the number of IPv4 route prefixes.

ipv6-threshold.description: Configure thresholds (one alarm threshold and one clear alarm threshold) for the number of IPv6 route prefixes.

upper-percent.description: Set the upper limit percent of the IPv6 prefix threshold.

lower-percent.description: Set the lower limit percent of the IPv6 prefix threshold.

start-time.description: Specifies the time of the first route or tunnel iteration suppression.

increase-time.description: Specifies the incremental suppression duration of route or tunnel iteration.

max-time.description: Specifies the maximum suppression duration of route or tunnel iteration.

relay-default-routes.description: List of routes that recurse to the default route globally.

relay-default-route.description: Configure route recursion to the default route globally.

ipv4-vpn-route-statisticss.description: List of statistics about routes of all VPN instances in the IPv4 routing table.

ipv4-vpn-route-statistics.description: All IPv4 VPN Instance route statistics.

total-num.description: Number of routes in the routing table.

active-num.description: Number of active routes in the routing table.

added-num.description: Number of active and inactive routes added to the routing table.

deleted-num.description: Number of routes deleted from the routing table.

freed-num.description: Number of routes that are permanently released from the routing table.

ipv6-vpn-route-statisticss.description: List of statistics about routes of all VPN instances in the IPv6 routing table.

ipv6-vpn-route-statistics.description: All IPv6 VPN Instance route statistics.

total-num.description: Number of routes in the routing table.

active-num.description: Number of active routes in the routing table.

added-num.description: Number of active and inactive routes added to the routing table.

deleted-num.description: Number of routes deleted from the routing table.

freed-num.description: Number of routes that are permanently released from the routing table.

unicast-route-statistics.description: Statistics of unicast route of all VPN instances.

ipv4-prefix-number.description: The number of IPv4 route prefixes for all VPN instances.

ipv6-prefix-number.description: The number of IPv6 route prefixes for all VPN instances.

static-routing.description: Configure a basic service package for static routes.

ipv4-site.description: Configure parameters for IPv4 static routes.

preference.description: Default priority of IPv4 static routes. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware. To query the default value, you can perform a get operation.

relay-switch.description: Enable/disable the function of selecting static routes based on recursion depths.

min-tx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv4 BFD packets are sent to the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

min-rx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv4 BFD packets are received from the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

relay-remote.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to remotely leaked VPN routes.

relay-arp-vlink.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to ARP Vlink routes.

inherit-cost-switch.description: Enable/disable the function of comparing the costs of inherited routes during static route selection.

current-route-num.description: Number of IPv4 static routes that have been configured.

max-route-num.description: Maximum number of IPv4 static routes that can be configured.

relay-srv6-nexthop.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to SRv6 routes.

enable.description: Enable/disable route recursion to tunnel. By default, this configuration takes effect for all routes. If an IP prefix list is configured, the configuration takes effect only for the routes that match the IP prefix list. If a tunnel policy is configured, routes carry the tunnel policy information when recursing to a tunnel.

ipv4-prefix-ref.description: Name of an IPv4 prefix list.

ipv6-site.description: Configure parameters for IPv6 static routes.

preference.description: Default priority of IPv6 static routes. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware. To query the default value, you can perform a get operation.

min-tx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv6 BFD packets are sent to the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

min-rx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv6 BFD packets are received from the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

relay-arp-vlink6.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv6 unicast static routes to ARP Vlink routes.

current-route-num.description: Number of IPv6 static routes that have been configured.

max-route-num.description: Maximum number of IPv6 static routes that can be configured.

relay-srv6-nexthop6.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv6 unicast static routes to SRv6 routes.

max-route-number.description: Statistics of static routes that can be configured, including IPv4 routes and IPv6 routes.

num.description: Maximum number of IPv4 and IPv6 static routes that can be configured.

bfd-admindowns.description: List of BFD sessions. A static route cannot be selected if the BFD session associated with it is in the AdminDown state.

bfd-admindown.description: Configure BFD session. A static route cannot be selected if the BFD session associated with it is in the AdminDown state.

static-routing_schema.description: Configure a basic service package for static routes.

ipv4-site.description: Configure parameters for IPv4 static routes.

preference.description: Default priority of IPv4 static routes. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware. To query the default value, you can perform a get operation.

relay-switch.description: Enable/disable the function of selecting static routes based on recursion depths.

min-tx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv4 BFD packets are sent to the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

min-rx-interval.description: Default minimum interval expected at which IPv4 BFD packets are received from the peer end. The default value can be controlled by the PAF file and varies according to hardware.

relay-remote.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to remotely leaked VPN routes.

relay-arp-vlink.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to ARP Vlink routes.

inherit-cost-switch.description: Enable/disable the function of comparing the costs of inherited routes during static route selection.

current-route-num.description: Number of IPv4 static routes that have been configured.

max-route-num.description: Maximum number of IPv4 static routes that can be configured.

relay-srv6-nexthop.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv4 unicast static routes to SRv6 routes.

enable.description: Enable/disable route recursion to tunnel. By default, this configuration takes effect for all routes. If an IP prefix list is configured, the configuration takes effect only for the routes that match the IP prefix list. If a tunnel policy is configured, routes carry the tunnel policy information when recursing to a tunnel.

relay-arp-vlink6.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv6 unicast static routes to ARP Vlink routes.

current-route-num.description: Number of IPv6 static routes that have been configured.

max-route-num.description: Maximum number of IPv6 static routes that can be configured.

relay-srv6-nexthop6.description: Enable/disable the function of recursing IPv6 unicast static routes to SRv6 routes.

max-route-number.description: Statistics of static routes that can be configured, including IPv4 routes and IPv6 routes.

num.description: Maximum number of IPv4 and IPv6 static routes that can be configured.

bfd-admindowns.description: List of BFD sessions. A static route cannot be selected if the BFD session associated with it is in the AdminDown state.

bfd-admindown.description: Configure BFD session. A static route cannot be selected if the BFD session associated with it is in the AdminDown state.
